intro: Valeriana alliariifolia var. intermedia, commonly known as the intermediate valerian, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface, and its flowering stems bear small, greenish-white flowers arranged in dense, spike-like clusters. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is often found in woodland edges, meadows, and along stream banks. Valeriana alliariifolia var. intermedia is valued for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
